etymology.description: 数(數) (shǔ, "to count") + 数(數) (shù, "number") implies the action of counting numbers.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 数(數) (shǔ, "to count") and 数(數) (shù, "number") denotes the activity of counting the numbers themselves. It highlights the process of enumeration.

examples.chinese: 小孩学数数(小孩學數數)。
examples.english: The child is learning to count.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢在公园数数花朵(她喜歡在公園數數花朵)，以欣赏它们的美丽(以欣賞它們的美麗)。
examples.pinyin: tā xǐhuān zài gōngyuán shǔ shù huāduǒ, yǐ xīnshǎng tāmen de měilì.
examples.english: She likes to count the flowers in the park to appreciate their beauty.

examples.chinese: 他们在学校数数积木(他們在學校數數積木)，锻炼数学能力(鍛鍊數學能力)。
examples.pinyin: tāmen zài xuéxiào shǔ shù jīmù, duànliàn shùxué nénglì.
examples.english: They count the building blocks in school to improve their math skills.
